title: Search for the Guru
description: Autobiographical account of spiritual awakening during the Woodstock Generation (late '60s - '73, going to India to hang out with Ram Dass and Neem Karoli Baba, meeting the "Bliss Permeated Mother," Anandamayi Ma, visiting Sathy Sai Baba, returning to the West and meeting Joseph Sunhawk at the Taos Publo, Trungpa Rinpoche and Chagdud Rinpoche and other saints and sages. It is the story of the quest for self-knowing and ultimate knowledge of the self, presented in a candid and often humorous way. It has been called a western "Autobiography of a Yogi."
author: Peter Mt. Shasta
